ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and from the evil of women who blow on knots
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: From the evil of sorceresses who blow incantations on knots,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: from the evil of the women who blow on knots;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: from the evil of those who practice witchcraft
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “And from the evil of the witches who blow into knots.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And from the evil of the blowers in knots,"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And from the evil of those who blow on knots,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: from the evil of the women who blow on knots,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And from the evil of malignant witchcraft,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: from the evil of those who blow on knots
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And from the evil of the women blowers upon knots,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and from the evil of the witches, who blow on knots,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: From the mischief of those who practise secret arts;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And from the evil of the witchcrafts when they blow in the knots,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: from the evil of the blowers on knots;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And from the evil of those who practice sorcery.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And from the evil of the blowers in knots
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [113:4] and from the evil of the women-blowers, sorceresses who blow, on knots, which they knot into strings, blowing into them [certain] words, but without spittle; however, al-Zamakhsharī says, ‘with this [spittle]’ — [sorceresses] such as the daughters of the said Labīd —
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And from the evil of malignant witchcraft,
